text:
Tap @ Angleterre. 
Poured near amber in color with a thin white head. 
Aroma has earthy, woody malty notes mostly. 
Stone fruits, some caramel, malts. Light flavors. Ok.
Can at OT. Hazy amber with a white head. Sticky pine, grass, orange and white bread. Very smooth and balanced. Elegant.
Cask @ Singer Tavern, London. Hazed deep-amber in colour. Hoppy with a sticky-sweet texture and mildly sweet in its nose. Has a dull taste.
Can at OT Sthlm. Very smooth ale with taste of milky oranges and white bread. Light bitterness.

Not as cloudy as I anticpated - it smells like a regular bestb itter with a persistent decent off white head. Tastes like english best bitter too, perhaps a bit breadier. Its nice enough, but Im not tremendously impressed - its not all that memorable.

Fra boks på Mi2 Cardinal mai-17: lett uklar gylden med særdeles tett og fint skum. En superfrisk og fruktig bitter, nesten som en ipa. Citrusfrukter og søte appelsiner. Avrundet, mild bitterhet og elegant syrlighet.
33cl can at home. Somewhat amber golden with a medium white head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Subtle bitter and sweet tones. Grain, citrus, caramel, some pine and fruits. Nice.
On cask. Hazy dark golden color with one finger fluffy head. Fruity aroma. Taste isnt as strong as the aroma, but it is a very drinkable beer.

330ml can from Gulating Ølutsalg, Tromsø. Remaining, bubbly, snow white head. Cloudy apricot coloured body. Crocheted lacing to the glassware. Tangy caramel fruity nose. Mixed taste of caramel, orange peels, and earth. Mid-dry bitter ending. Smooth on the swallow. Likable (01.04.2017).

33cl Can @ The Beer Garden Store, Madrid, Spain.
Hazy amber colour with a tan head.
Aroma is malt, herbs, grass, bread, citrus.
Taste is malt, hops, citrus, caramel, pine.
Medium body, average to soft carbonation.
Good blend between a Bitter and an IPA.
Handpumped @ Luppolo 12, Roma. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are caramel, fruits, malt, rich hops and has a nice fruity finish.

Moor Raw
Bitter
64437

Lukt: Malt og frukter.
Utseende: Rødgul.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Tørre frukter, malt, tørr avslutning.
Hvor: Mellombesl, Bryne..

Shared can at Cardinal Pub & Bar, Moor Night presentation. Deep glden colour, moderate white head. Moderate earthy aroma. Very "English" flavour, earthy and herbal hops, sufficient malts for its ABV, medium dry.
UPDATED: MAY 22, 2017 Shared can at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours hazy amber with off-white head. Aroma of oranges, some caramel, some floral notes. Tastes bitter. Dry mouth feel, bitter finish.

330ml can. Hazy golden amber pour with a nice beige head. Aroma of grainy malts, caramel, hoppy, citrus fruits, grass. Taste is pretty much what you expect from that aroma, sweetish malts with a nice bitter fruity hoppiness. Nicely balanced with a nice moderate bitterness, medium bodied. Rarely do I find a Bitter Id happily drink again but this is one is very drinkable.

Ljus bärnsten, disig. Maltig doft med inslag av frukt: tropiska, citrus och lite tallbarr. Ganska tunn smak, lite hö, lite frukt, rätt bra beska. Ingen höjdare, varken traditionell maltbaserad engelsk ale eller modernt humlad så att den blir något spännande.
Provning på De Klomp.
On tap at OConnors. Golden amber with beige head. Aroma is nutty, bready, slight soapy hops. Taste is similar, malty, fairly complex with soapy and slight fruity hops. Plain and drinkable

Cask Half Pint at Waterloo Tap, London in May 2016 - Cloudy Amber in colour. Good creamy off-white head. Excellent lacing. Malty; grainy malts, caramel. Fruity; grapefruit and orange citrus. Hoppy; grassy and herbal hops. Good malt/fruit/hop balance. Moderately bitter malty fruity throughout. Very drinkable. Good stuff. 
(2016-05-12)

33 cl can.
Pours dark orange color with a large lasting head. Nutty aroma with dried fruits and caramel notes, mild hops with some hay and pine. Flavor is bitter malty, slightly sweet caramel-y with dried fruits and grassy notes. Carbonation is strong, finishes dry and short, simple.
3414

Aroma; citric notes, open pine forest, strawberry, grass, mild roasted bread. Look; hazy brown body, fawn head. Taste; bread, mandarin, sweet pine, berry, grass - soft balanced finish. Feel; smooth. Overall; nice, quality. [33cl.can 4.3% BB:E.AUG2017 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ø]
Nice and easy. Suave y agradecida. Poco bitter y mucho medium. Un poco acuosa. Ok

Lattina. Il gusto al naso è di frumento, di luppolo e di floreale. Lintensità olfattiva è elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma abbondante ha una buona tenuta con persistenza lunga. La grandezza delle bollicine si divide tra media e grossolana. Laspetto del liquido è nuvoloso. Le bollicine sono medio-fini e permangono sulla parete del bicchiere. Il colore è ambrato torbido. Il corpo è pieno. Lamaro è medio. Lintensità gustativa è normale e la persistenza gustativa è sufficiente. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono luppolate e di facile beva. Il finale è amarognolo e semplice. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. Laroma in bocca riporta sentori di miele, biscotto, cereali, resina e lievito.
Uit blik geschonken. Een hoppige, fruitige bitter. Smaken zijn mooi zacht maar wel aanwezig met een zachte bitterheid. Prima!

Medium offwhite head. Hazy, nearly opaque, coppery body. Resiny tropical fruit aroma with strawberry jam and flour notes. Dryish mealy tropical fruit taste with resiny notes. Mid-bodied. Sharpish, mealy mouthfeel. Dryish resiny mealy aftertaste with wooden orangey notes. The aroma is great, but the flavour is a bit one-dimensional and harsh. (0.33l can, from some shop near home in Norway.)
33cl can from ales by mail. Cloudy orange color. Thin medium head. Medium bitterness. Medium body. Aroma and flavour is hops, malt, herbs, orange, pine, resin. Very very good as usual.

Aroma of fruits, malt, resin, grass and a hint of citrus. Amber with a off-white head. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body with a average to soft carbonation. Overall a quite plesant and interesting Bitter.

Draught by beer machine @ Birra Berlin.
Unfiltered, amber, not very persistent white head. 
Flowery, earthy, typical Golding Fugglrs.
Clean bitterness, fruity, soft carbonation.

1.5dl on tap at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam, Moor tap takeover. Nose is light malty. Body is opalescent orange, head is medium, cream white, creamy, mostly lasting, good lacing. Aroma is malty, tea, leaves. Light sweet, medium bitter. Finish is long lasting hoppy medium bitter. Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Easy, refreshing bitter beer, simple but tasty, nice one.
(Draught) Pours a hazy golden body with a medium white head. Aroma of herbs, grass, straw, and florals. Flavor of herbs, grass, lemon peel, and caramel with a dry finish.

Can from the brewery. Hazy orange brown with a white head. Aroma of grass and autumn leaves. Taste is not a typical bitter - there is a strong hint of citrus along with pine resin and grass. Also some earthy flavours and a slightly oily, herbacious taste. A great beer, but more like an IPA than a bitter. really delicious.
Ámbar turbio y espuma blanca. Aroma ligeramente cítrico y mueble viejo. Cuerpo bajo y sabor como en aroma con una final de amargor medio.
Tap @fermentoren. Pours golden with a White head. Aroma of sweet fruits like plums and orange. Some hay and Honey. Taste of sweet Malts, grains, straw, biscuit and grassy hops.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Golden, orange pour with a generous head. Notes of caramel, some herbal notes, nutty, toasty and light bitterness.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours slightly hazy golden orange with an creamy offwhite head. Aroma of malt, caramel, little bread, light spicy hops, grass, fruit. Flavor is light sweet, malt, caramel, toast, grass, light herbal, fruit. Medium body, average carbonation. 180916

Tap @ Fermentoren Aarhus, 4,3%. Hazy dark amber with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, caramel, hop and grass. Flavour is malt, caramel, toasted, biscuit, hop, medium sweet, grass and a little bitter.

Can bought at Cambridge Wine Merchants, Cherry Hinton Road. Ochre-brown with plentiful visible carbonation. Floral grassy hop with some tangerine. Full bitter hit which finishes as it starts. Never overly bitter but powerful nonetheless. Grass and mango in the aftertaste. The body is a bit watery but this is nicely hidden by the full-on carbonation.

Can from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Poured a hazy medium amber with a thin white head and some broken lace. The aroma is yeast, zesty citrus. The flavour is moderate bitter with a big, crisp, citrus fruit, light pepper spice, hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

Can : Bright orange colour is vibrant and the white foam is  rocky , foamy and dense . Not flat at all ,wtf? Nose of textbook Bitter nuances, with suggestions of caramel , boiled sweets, light hops and old men . Flavours have everythiing I mentioned in the nose , but with an oily kinda earthy hop texture and thats cool .

Can from Favourite Beers, Cheltenham. Cloudy amber with a frothy cream head. Pleasant citrus aroma. The taste has plenty of citrus and moderate spice before a bitter finish. Some background toast, but something a bit plasticy too.

Can from The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a hazy amber colour with a thin white head. Aroma of orange, fruit, some biscuity malts and subtle earthy hops. Taste of orange, fruits, some biscuity malts and subtle spicy, earthy hops. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. A short, fruity, earthy hop bitterness in the finish. A nice fruity bitter with some biscuity malt sweetness. Very easy drinking.

Hazy amber colour with big foamy head. Fruity and hoppy with notes of orange peel and marmalade. Malty and fruity taste with citric bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with light sweetness. Balanced.

Grain anand cereal malts, fruity, biscuit, light citrus fruits. Clear gold, small, frothy, white head. Light sweet. Grain and biscuit malts, light sweetness continues, citrus fruits, grapefruit. Nice Bitter, served from Keg, nice and cold, very quaffable. Keg at Beer Emporium, Bristol.
Dark orange colour, white head. Aroma of herbs, honey, biscuits. Taste is light sweet, light bitter. Tea flavour. Light body, thin to slick texture, average carbonation.

Draft glass. NITRO @ Billies Bierkafetaria. Dark amber orange, creamy tanned head. Nose is mild hay bitterness, orange, caramel, herbal, tad pine, mellow & pleasant. Taste is super easy to drink, creamy, dry orange, pine, bitter leaves, herbal, mellow lightly lingering herbal & pine hop finish, bread, lightly fruity. Drinks really well, very pleasant beer. Subtle & satisfactory.
Nitrotap at billies. Pours unclear dark amber, small white head. Smell is very weak. Taste is bit bitter, bit malty, rather weak but ok.

330 ml can bought at Great Food Hall in Pacific Place, Admiralty. Looks: Cloudy hazy amber brown colour with an few small lumps of yeast particlesOne-quarter finger head with soapy white foam which fades in 30 seconds; Very Good sticky lacing and zero carbonation. Aroma: Quite fragrant and sweet Ale malt, with strong caramel, toffee, floral nectar, molasses, fair dark fruits, light red fruits, yeast and light lemon. Taste: Close to light sweet light Ale malt, with caramel, floral, light molasses, strong resin, light earth, dry biscuits, yeast, strong lemon, fairly strong bitter hops and strong fresh grass. Body: Close to light body. Dry, slick and oozy palate. Mouth Feel: Close to fair Ale maltyness in a thin but very slick background. Light caramel and moderately light sweetness balanced by strong ooze and earth. Lean, dry and yeasty with strong lemon to round. Crisp and nice! Hoppiness: floral nectar and light lemon in nose. Floral, strong resin, earth, strong lemon, and strong grass in taste; Bitterness is quite strong for a lasting, high astringent biscuit malty finish. After Taste: Dry. Oozy and strong bitter to mouth.

Comments: Compare to Moor Revival, this one is more traditional English Bitter with fuller dry biscuity malt, sweet aroma, and lots of oozy earthy English hoppiness. Crisp and strong, its pretty impressive and enjoyable from start to finish. Recommended!

Can from Brewcraft at home. Hazy dark amber pour with fluffy white head. Aroma is musty hops - some apple. Taste is more malty with an unusual spicy background hint. Some English-y bitter hops. Not that exciting. Not as good as the other Moor ones.

Drank w Matt the night before drumming at Orange Peel. Hazy brown-copper, very thick sudsy white head. Smells quite malty, grainy, some multigrain or rye bread and some grape. Taste is light lemon spiced hop, very bitter esp. in the finish but a bit empty. Body has medium oiliness, some frothiness. Malty nose + hoppy taste. Fine but not very special or memorable.

Can at home picked up from Bottle Shop Bermondsey. A clouded dark orange amber coloured pour with a big rocky off white head. Aroma is nice mix of tropical fruit, tangerine, orange, mango and some raw grains, wheat. Flavour is composed of raw grains, bready, some wheat, mixed fruit, mango, tangerine. Palate is grainy, abrassive carbonation, semi sweet. OK.

Appearance- light amber/orange, a one finger white head which gradually fades. Aroma- orange, caramel malt, tangerine, pineapple, fruit juice, biscuity malt. Taste- bitter hops, grapefruit, pineapple juice, hop resin, pine, biscuit, creamy malt undertones. Reasonably full mouthfeel. Very tasty.

Cervesa suau i amb bon aroma, es nota molt els tocs a caramel i a galeta amb un lleuger toc cítric.
Cerveza suave y con buen aroma, se nota mucho los toques a caramelo y a galleta con un ligero toque cítrico.

Base maltosa, caramelosa con aromas frutales, sobre todo naranja y algo resinados. En boca buen ekilibrio dulce amargi para dar lo q es una bitter, con ese pasadillo de lupulo. Buena mierda como todo lo q hace esta gente. Me clavo 4 pintas de esto sin inmutarme.

Cask @ The Rake, London - UK. Color: golden blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: hoppy and grassy. Floral hint, hoppy nose. Taste: medium body with good grassy hoppy taste. Good attenuation Very easy drainable. Perfect english style beer with good hoppy notes. Aftertaste: floral and grass with wet bitterness.

Pours murky amber with two fingers of white head. Aroma of light pine and citrus, hints of caramel, some rye. Taste is mild to medium bitter up front, slight astringent off flavor, mild sweet finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.
Ikke så humlet,men dejlig sødlig i det. En fin øl til en stille aften foran pejsen.

Bottle from Beermerchants. Pours clear dark golden with a bg creamy off-white head. Aroma of herbal hops, strong and inviting with bready malts lurking in the back. Taste is light dry, herbal hoppy all the way to the lingering finish, very good.

Can from Cotteridge Wines, Cotteridge, Birmingham, consumed at home Saturday 9th January 2016   Mid amber in colour with a mid sized white/off white head, slight cloudiness. Light caramel jostles with a touch of orange juice and a little biscuit, hops noticeable but somewhat restrained for a Moor beer but it is a good bitter. A6 A4 T7 P3 Ov13 3.3
amber with white head, cloudy looking. hoppy and bitter. very correct bitter ale. you could have 3 or 4 pints and not get bored.
Hand pump, @Ale&Hop, Barcelona. 14/11/2015. Color amarillo oscuro, sabor caramelo, herbal, cuerpo medio.
Can conditioned at the Castle Tap in Reading. Largely opaque with a great foamy head - a nice looking beer, surprisingly from a can. Fresh grapefruit aroma. Very dry, zesty and decent pale bitter.

September 11, 2014 - on (cask - corrected to cask from draught) at Euston Tap. Cloudy (unfiltered, so ... yeah, of course!) deep brownish-amber with a small foamy beige head. The aroma is pretty mild - fairly cold? - floral/fruity light caramel bitter with extra hop bitterness and somewhat more alcohol presence than a standard bitter. Taste follows - simple, light, sneaky-bitter and amazingly easy to drink (my pint essentially disappeared immediately) - very light body and carbonation, only a medium finish - I love the interplay between the soft but very present hop bitterness and malt backbone ... very flavourful indeed.
Bottle @ Odense Summer Gathering, 2015. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Peach, grass, and grain. Medium bodied.
Odense ratebeer summer gathering 2015. Pours amber with a white head. Aroma of malts, sugar, citrus, candy. Taste is malts, citrus, sugar. Decent

Super-charged fruity English-style bitter-cum-pale aled hop-per. 

Dark amber. 

Sweet aroma - Red grapefruit/ orange chocolate/ hint of bubblegum.

No massive initial attack; pretty constant goldie lookin bitter vibes - nicely balanced, although a little too much fizz. 

Slow finish to mild bitterness.

The session beer of the future.
On tap at Irreale. Orange colour with off white head. Mild, hoppy, malt aroma. Sweet, malt taste, slightly fruity and hoppy. Light to medium body.

From 660 ml bottle. Pours a hazy amber with a thin but lasting white head that leaves good lacing. Aromas of caramel, orange, raisins, flowers and a little spice. Taste starts off with gentle orange and apple juice before a lightl pepper and pine note come through. Finishes with sweet malty caramel leading into a spicy aftertaste. Enjoyed this.
Bottle from Glug, Newcastle. A cloudy amber coloured beer that pours with a large foamy head. It has an orange and toffee flavour, citrus and pine notes followed by gentle bitter woody finish.
Cloudy amber with a small white head. Malty aroma with a grassy note. Malty and grassy flavour, with a fruity touch
Oxydised slight earthy hop. Murky pretty standard nice enough drinking but nothing to wow over
Bottle from bottle-shop.eu. Beautiful amber colour, white foam. Medium carbonation. Nose of tropical fruit and grapefruit. Some caramel and toast. Medium dry and bitter finish. Very good bitter!

Bottle 0.66l at Little Tommie Birthday party Pozarevac Serbia.Happy Birthday Tommie and Ciaoooo Alberto.Pour it dark amber color with medium white head.On the nose floral, Taste and aroma of hops, citrus in the middle, fruits on the end, caramel also in some parts.Nice one.

Drunk from large 66cl bottle bought at Deliciously Different in Belgium. Enjoyable brown hoppy ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

In Pozarevac-Serbia at Tommie's 2 years party, bottle. I love you my little boy. Pours amber coppery, a bit hazy with a medium off-white head. Nose: hops blast, floral and malty notes, Amber malts. Mouth: very well balanced and distributed bitterness, a hint of caramel, malts. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cask @ Bath Brew House, Bath. 11-08-2014.
Pours hazy amber with nice off white head., some lacing. Malty, caramel , liquorice aromas. Taste follows the nose, some sweet aftertaste.Enjoyable.

Backlog rating. Cask at The Gun Docklands, part of Spring Haze Beer Fest, London. It pours a clean golden amber color with a small white head. Aroma is mild caramel, dried leaves, grass, bread, soil. Taste is medium sweet and lightyl citrousy, with notes of bread, grass, caramel. Overall, tasty bitter
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy amber/orange pour with a big frothy beige head, tangerine aroma, taste has light bitter grapefruit, tangerine, light caramel, light bitterness.
Bottle from The Wine Emporium 260914. Strong orange amber colour with no bitterness and an enjoyable light finish.
bottle from Darts Farm Topsham. Golden colour, white head. Fruity nose (apple). Medium-bodied, good malty flavours and nice fruity accents, mainly apple and perhaps a touch of apricot.
660ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours clear amber, thin white head. Stewed apple aromas, caramel. Taste has a gentle bitterness, light sweet, juicy fruit. Clean finish. Not bad
Orange to amber in colour, quite hazy. Aroma and flavour of sweet, caramelised peaches. Full flavoured and hoppy.
Le bitter inglesi non sono proprio le birra che vado a cercare, ma comunque questa mi è sembrata superiore alla media. Niente male.

Draft at BD ShepBush. Murky burnt orange, moderate cream head, moderate lacing. Aromas of biscuit, breadcrusts, woody hops, light grapefruit. Moderate sweet toasty malt, moderate bitter, light citrus, resin, some soft fruit. Decent carbonation, lightish body, shortish finish.

Bottle from Beer Central, Sheffield. 4.5%. Hazy orange. Thin, bubbly, off white head. Light grapefruit. Soft toffee. Sweet grain. Some fust, too. Taste is light, strawberry sweet. Light dry. Pithy bitter. Palate is dry and crisp. Finish is dry, with a lengthy, bitter close. Nice best bitter.
Hazy amber beer with a light fruit and malt aroma. Flavour is light and hoppy with a touch of peach. Leaves a bitter floral taste in the mouth. Cery drinkable.

Keg at Drygate. Murky bronze body with a medium white head. Nice lacing. Aroma of tea, caramel and biscuit. Flavour of wood, green tea and a bright, grassy finish. Thin body with a spritzy mouthfeel. Lively fizz. Subtle and tasty.

.3 on tap @Harrys 
Pours cloudy reddisj copper with low creamy head. Aroma is yeast, dried fruits, malts, plums. Flavor is yeast, herbs, hops, malts and.bready notes. A bit too yeasty...
Cask west riding dewsbury. Hazy amber colour good off white head lacing. Not much aroma. Taste is nice slight roasted nutty sweet biscuit malts light bitter finish. Medium body. Nice taste to this.
Keg at the Hanging Bat. Pours hazy golden, burnt toffee nose, sweet, chewy, toffee and caramel, dry.

0,66L bottle, BB 16.12.2014. Pours amber with off white head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is malt, fruits, caramel, and slight metallic notes. Taste is sweet and bitter, caramel, fruits, citrus, apricot, and malt. Finish is dry and grapefruit bitter. Overall: nice session beer.
Cask @ Dukes, Dalston. Hazy gold, very light lemon citrus in the taste, a light grassiness, some spice and a dry bitter finish. Sessionable but somewhat forgettable.

Hazy orange, medium to small bubbly white head. Nose is toasty malt, caramel, fruity tones, hops. Flavor is caramel hints with toasty malt, fruit, caramel, crisp and mild spicy hops in the semi-dry finish. Very sessionable.

22 oz. bottle dated best by 3/20/15. It pours a hazy burnt orange color with a small off white head. The aroma has some light toasted malt with dried apricot, grass and citrus. Maybe a touch of dank. The flavor is oranges, grass, lightly toasted malt and a tangy citric bitterness in the finish. Light bodied, but the amber colored malts give it more substance. Very tasty.
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty caramel aroma with weak citrus hoppy hints. Fruity malty caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy caramel finish.
Bottled. Orange coloured.Hazy. Dense beige head. Aroma. caramel, fruits, light herbs, citrus. Flavour. caramel, grass, herbs, lihgt citrus and some fruits. Medium bodied. Ends herbal bitter.

Sample from 66 cl. bottle. Unclear, golden colour with a thin, off-white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, grape, grasses and light caramel malts. Taste is bitter. Medium body with a thinner texture. Finishes bitter and dry with fruits and grasses. Very enjoyable Bitter.

Bottle at yespr.
Cloudy amber coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel and citrus with notes of spices.
Fruity flavour of caramel, grass and hops.
Hoppy finish.
Bottled. A hazy golden beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of straw, malt, and lemons. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw, lemons, and straw, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottle. Light hazy yellow/golden with a small white head. Toffee, caramel, grain, straw, green plan material, citrus. Light/medium body, light/medium sweet and bitter. Dry and bitter finish. Not overly interesting but balanced and sessionable.
Bottle @ Yespr tasting. Hazy amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and light hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderte bitter finish. 110414
66 cl. bottle. Amber colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, malt, fruit, spice and caamel.
Hard to split from the Moor Revival. Very similar with more grass focus but dies well for the style. Incredibly balanced. Nice stuff

66 cl bottle @ home, BBE 10/2014
Aroma is quite light with some resiny hops, vanilla and juicy fruity tones. Flavour has vegetable tones, some resiny hops, minerals, woody notes and juicy fruits. Too much off-flavours here.

660 ml bottle from Ales By Mail, served in nonic pint glass. Beautiful dark sunrise orange, slightly hazy, with a off-white head which leave good lacing. Aroma of mainly spicy and herbal hops, caramel malts, biscuits/crackers, orange jam. Very pleasent moderate bitterness upfront, followed by a honey-like sweetness before a malty and toffee aftertaste. Spot-on average carbonation, on the lighter side of medium body, slightly creamy texture. Huge drinkabilty, definitely a proper session beer.

Medium head and carbonation amber pour aromas citrus stone fruit biscuit flavours medium bitter grapefruit lemon caramel stone fruit mild tropical tastes the finish liked the ale good mix of hops and malt lasting bitter goes down well

Cask tulip, Small Bar, Bristol, 18/01/14. Clouded apricot beneath a slim white top. Bilious orange, butter dabs, stale OJ and pine. OJ and pine nose. Dull beer in dubious condition. Hard work on a hangover.

660ml bottle. Minimally cloudy, copper-ish amber colour with small, frothy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Hoppy aroma has a herbal touch, notes of gooseberry and other berries, caramel malty background. Taste is fruity hoppy, notes of red and yellow berries, stone fruit, some hop bitterness. Nice hoppy Bitter.

Bottle, Christmas present from Lalitha. Cool bottle. Poured cloudy amber with long lasting white head. Full hoppy aroma. Very robust version of classic bitter, plenty of malt toffee and bread, then bitter hop finish. Probably a really good one to have several of in the pub, less of one for a bottle at home. Tasty bitter.
Ambrata biona dchiuma discreta persistenza buon naso luppolato con note maltate biscottate non molto corpo discreta secchezza buon amaro non molto lunga
UPDATED: DEC 16, 2013 Interesting. A lovely soft, sweet, hazy, murky, bitter kind of drink. Peach and wood vibes, nice, though one pint is enough.

(Cask at Dean Swift, Tower Bridge, London, 23 Nov 2013) Hazy amber colour with brief, foamy head. Fruity, hoppy nose with notes of orange peel, apricots and marmalade. Malty, fruity taste with apricots, orange, toast and a balanced citric bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with balanced sweetness. Tasty and well balanced. Nice one.

Bottle at home from ales by mail
Hazy (unfined) dark amber with spicey yeast esters and nettley hop. Dry malt, English hops, medium body dry finish. Fine
Bottle cloudy golden color. Aroma is a hint of fruity Aroma hops taste is very smoth with malts and some bitterness aftettaste is Medium bitter very nice One

0.66 bottle. Copper hazy. Nice set of apricot, some herbal earthyness, and slightly bready amberish malts on nose. Lightish body. Nicely bittered- not too much, just enough for the body. Some hoppy greenery, caramels. Nice, easily drunk hoppy pale.

0.66 l bottle, thanks hanniku! Slightly hazy amber color. Sweet caramelly and resiny aroma with pine. Caramelly, nutty, resiny and somewhat bitter taste with meaty yeastiness. Medium body. Suffers slightly from yeastiness.
Cask air pressure at Euston Tap. Hazy light brown lasting white head. Citrus floral hop aroma. A little earthy later on. A little medicinal chalkiness isnt great. Not the best but not horrible

Hazy orange color, small white head. Aroma of fruity hops. Taste is fruity too, with hops, malt, yeast, grass - dry bitter with long hoppy aftertaste. Thin body, soft carbonation. Quite good beer for easy drinking.

660ml bottle from Ales by Mail
BBE 31 Aug 2014 - Pours dark orange with a small white head. Aroma of caramely malts, floral hops, grass and hints of herbs. Taste is caramely malty, crisp and bitter with hints of floral and herbal hops. Finish is smooth, slightly bitter and fruity with hints of crisp grassy notes. Okay, quite hoppy bitter.

660ml bottle (Drink Shop, Tallinn)
Orange, small off-white head. Dishcloth aroma, wooly. Simple thin palate. Earthy taste. More dishwater. Rough.
Bottle 0.66l, thanks to FatPhil. Colour is cloudy amber with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, sweetness, caramel, hints of toffee, hops and malts.

(Bottle, 0.66 l - 30 Jun 2014, courtesy of FatPhil, 20130914) The beer poured amber and cloudy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, sweetness, soap and toffee. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, malts, sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy, sweet and bitter. A hoppier bitter. Not bad.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2014 Cask @ Inn Deep & 660ml bottle from Ales By Mail. Hazy reddish amber brown, good head. Oaty fruity malt aroma. Tropical fruit, caramel, hop & malt flavour. Very smooth & well balanced. Slightly bitter aftertaste. A really good bitter. Cask better than bottle. Rating here for cask.

660ml bottle in Bristol. Pours slightly cloudy, darkish-Weissbier-like. Nose yeasty, slightly tart, banana. Flavour not dissimilar - yeasty, nice bitter tang, slightly floral, bit of malt toast. Good stuff.

Draught @ La Bona Pinta, Barcelona. Pours a cloudy amber colour with a thick creamy head. Aroma of grass, herbs and some floral notes. Flavour of pale malts, some caramel, strobg herbal hop profile, some floral notes. Medium bodied, aoft carbonation and very smooth mouthfeel. Finishes dry, slightly sweet and very bitter. Great.

Cask @ Catford Bridge Tavern, London, 28/08/13. Pours dark amber with a small, off-white head. Aroma is flowery, fresh, crisp, light mint. Taste is some caramel and biscuit. Some citrus. Long, dry aftertaste. Light, good carbonation.

Tap @ YNWA, Kolding. Pours murky dark orange with a large, creamy, white head. Aroma has grassy hops, caramel, light doughy. Mild oranges. Low carbonation, fine dry and light creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good bitterness, grassy, grapefruit. Long, lingering bitterness. Nice.

Bottle from Grape n Grind, Bristol. For a bitter, this is pretty damn fine. Very little revealed by the nose. Pours a cloudy orange. Flavour is rich with sweet, crunchy malts and freshened nicely with juicy, citrusy hops. Finish is balanced, dry and moreish. Great session bitter.
660ml bottle. Clear brown color. Tiny to almost no head. Sour, hops, malty aroma. Hops, grainy, slightly metallic notes in flavor. Watery texture. Mild bitter aftertaste.

My Bottom Line:
Citrusy hops build peppery bitterness, as subtle caramel and peaches create balance.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A creamy sheet of foam settles atop the misty amber blond.
-The nose is nicely delicate, which doesnt really fit with the beers name.
-All flavours are well leveled.
-There is some hay in the malt flavors.
-The mouthfeel is lean and drinkability very high.

On cask at The Horniman at Hays.
On cask at Open Baladin Roma. Nice amber body with soapy head. Nose is cheddar, malts, soap. Taste is hops, spices, malts, berries. Really nice. Solid bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2013 Cask conditioned	handpump	Coal Hole	London	30/04/13.  A naturally hazy amber coloured beer with an off-white head.  A perfumed hoppy aroma.  Sherbertty fizzy in the mouth.  Lots of fruitiness with s definite yeastiness.  A bit of pear drop too.  Rather nice.  Score 3.7Subsequent rating scored 3.4. Average becomes 3.6

Cask @ some Nicholsons pub in Soho. The pours light hazy amber with a medium head. Soft tropical fruit nose. A bit of pineapple and cantaloupe. Sugar snap cereal. Pissy hay. The taste is mild ctirus and more piss. Cereal. White bread. Some more tropical flavors and sweet syrup. Light body, moderately bitter on the finish. Overall, OK.

Cask by handpump at Drum & Monkey, Glasgow - amber with a slight protein haze, thin creamy off-white head, good lacing, pungent blood citrus aroma, orange barley water flavour with bitter lemon hop afterglow
so dry...resin grass in taste that is so armonic with flavor...this is definetely a session beer to drink in warm wet summer days!

cask at the mitre.. light hazy amber ... thin white head ... soft zezty fruit nose ... oily fruits ... soft orange toffee .... floral orange ... juicy fruits ... rich and sweet ... hints of blood orange

On tap @ the Haymarket, Edinburgh. Pours a light amber colour with a nicely proportioned head. The nose has floral notes with a hint of perhaps peaches. The taste has more of the flowers and stone fruit. The palate is light to medium in body with a creamy texture and a long refreshing finish. Overall, a good cask experience.
from cask at The Clarence, Mayfair.  Clear medium amber orange color pour and average sized frothy white head. Tastes of caramel, malty fruits

Cask at the Old Contemptibles, Brum. Definitely feels like a traditional UK Bitter sort of a Bitter, but a good one. Malty, brown bread, with dry hops and some tart fruit to finish. Fantastic mouthfeel.

Cask @ Haymarket, Edinburgh [200313]
Amber, clear, thin white head. Aroma of soft zesty hops, light grass, citrus. Taste of soft zesty hop, soft citrus, light pale malts, simple flavours, easy going. Palate - thinnish body, finish as main flavour, soft bitter tail.
Overall - OK - not one of their best though

Cask at the Euston Tap 01/02/13.
Murky orange/amber with a thin off white head that recedes to leave but a swirl.
Nose is light hops, soured fruits.
Taste comprises caramel, fruits, touch of sugars, malty.
Medium bodied with a dry finish.
Ok.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Bridge Tavern, SE London - Fuzzy orange/amber pour with a frothy persistent white head and lacing. Prominent biscuit grain malt and citrus notes. Good bitter finish. Good stuff this.
Cask conditioned at The Victoria Hotel, Leeds. Gold with white head. Fullish maltiness and with a bitter hoppy, dry character, grapefruity, tangy, very pleasant.

Cask at 4:20. Clear amber pour with a frothy, white head. Fruity, sweaty aroma, some biscuit malts. Lightly sweet, some earth, grapefruit, dry cereal. Light in body with soft carbonation. Pretty dry finish, rindy hops, some wood. Very decent.
From tap at 4:20. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is fruity and slight citrusy hoppy. Bitter, dry and grapefruity. Dry and bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2011 Draught @Brasserie 4:20 (Rome) - Bitter straordinaria! Bellissimo colore ambrato, vivissimo, abbastanza limpido. Aroma complesso, amaro-fruttato. In bocca parte dolciastra, lievemente mielosa e caramellata, fruttata (mela, pesca) con note acidule e un finale luppolato, moderatamente amaro. Rinfrescante e gradevolissima.

Cask @ Brasserie 4:20, Via Portuense 82, Roma, Italy.Clear medium amber orange color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted - caramel, fruity, light to moderate hoppy, apricot - peachy. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, a long bitter bitter finish. Body is medium to light, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20101219]

Cask-conditioned at the Seven Stars, Bristol 22/06/10. Unfined and dry hopped. Hazy, deep amber in colour with a slight, white head. Aroma of fresh, slightly herbal hops and cereal malts. Flavour had chewy, biscuit malts, some apricot fruit and a dense, bitter finish. Unusual and enjoyable.
